Author: uuilly
Content: I like the site.  I just watched a few interviews and they were all above average.  I'll definitely come back.  But I have no idea how it will scale if they have to conduct every interview.

Author: run4yourlives
Content:
I thought that comment lent a lot of insight into the mind of the author.

On one hand, he's trying to make a buck. On the other, he figures it's okay to take advantage of someone else in the same situation.

I wonder if he even understands the contradiction of ethics?

Author: iamelgringo
Content: Why in the world does CNET need 2600 employees?  Talk about Payroll bloat.

Author: queensnake
Content: In the US I believe they're not allowed to ask your age in an interview (along with race, religion, IQ, sexual orientation, state of health (these last two I'm less sure of), some other things). Of course they'll know it eventually, and the number of years experience you claim on your resume would give it away, too.

Author: edw519
Content:
I think he's confusing "programmer" with "developer".

"Elite developers ... blah blah blah..."

May I suggest...

"Elite developers are elite because they're far more concerned with delivering results than caring how it's delivered."

Author: dood
Content:
Excellent, fast-loading makes a huge difference in enjoyment of using a site for me.

Any chance of More links for user-comment pages?

Author: jotto
Title: Ask YC: where to order cheap food (generic cereal etc..) online?
Content: I looked at Amazon and Froogle, and most are more expensive than the grocery store. Amazon has free shipping for orders over $25 though. I want to eat cheap but fairly healthy - and I don't care about taste but no monkey chow please.

Author: mechanical_fish
Content:
I think I heard this guy interviewed on the Nature podcast last year, when his Nature paper came out (warning, PDF link):

http://www.nagyvaryviolins.com/Nagyvary_Nature_Page.pdf

He was great. His contention is that the key to the unique sound of the Strads and other great violins of that era is the treatment of the wood, which the makers did to preserve it better.

Apparently the heirs lost the recipe, replaced it with something else, then spent nearly 300 years lost and wandering in Violin Phase Space trying to figure out where they went wrong. Those of us who have worked in semiconductor manufacturing recognize this problem all too well. :)

Author: edw519
Content:
"...24 concentrated hours spread out over 4 days..."

Oh.

Reminded me of the old Steven Wright joke when he went to the Quickie Mart and it was closed.

He said, "But the sign says 'Open 24 Hours'"

The owner replied, "Not in a row."

Author: dcurtis
Content:
Awesome.

When you have time, here's my wishlist:

1 Change password functionality

2 Make the "Y" logo at the top go to the hacker news index (I always accidentally click it and go to ycombinator.com)

3 Make the foot that is on the index page with links to Y Combinator, feature requests, etc, be standard on all pages.

Thanks!
